title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.8 - Accepted plans
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.8 - Accepted plans

State Regulations
(a) The chairman shall give to the carrier, and if the carrier is not the employer
or association of employers or association of employees by whom the application
for acceptance was filed, then also to the applicant, written notice that the
plan is accepted as satisfying the obligation of the employer or employers to
provide for the payment of benefits, or that it is not accepted. From and after
the effective date of notice of acceptance, the provision for benefits and
employee contributions under such plan shall be effective for the employees, or
the class or classes of employees, entitled to benefits under the plan, in lieu
of the provision for benefits under section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law and for employee contributions under section
209. (b) In the event a
self-insured employer, association of employers, or association of employees
subject to an accepted plan fail to pay benefits after being found liable under
section
221
of the Workers' Compensation Law, the board shall draw on the security deposit
required by section
361.3
of this Title to pay
benefits at the rate provided for in section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
358-3.8

Amended

New

York State Register July 19, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 29, eff. 7/19/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
